N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 89.5 - Duration of supplemental benefits

State Regulations

The maximum cumulative period during which a supplemental
benefit shall be paid with respect to any specific injury or disease suffered
by an employee as the result of his or her employment shall be nine months; provided, however, nothing herein shall prevent the employee from electing to
continue to receive his or her full salary by charging appropriate leave
accruals during the period prior to the payment of compensation pursuant to
section
12
of
the Workers' Compensation Law where the claim of the employee has not been
controverted. In the event it becomes necessary to adjust the compensation
otherwise payable to an employee upon a change in such employee's status, said
adjustments shall be made in accordance with the procedures promulgated
pursuant to this regulation. Notes
